They will elevate and jump on any opportunity to virtue signal about how they've rooted out racism against a minority, a woman, or a gay person, but when they discriminate openly by saying they will hire/promote in favor of those groups, (which is, in effect, discrimination against white men), then that's called being anti-racist and anti-sexist. Look at Trudeau - decided arbitrarily to have a 50-50 male/female split in his cabinet, effectively discriminating based on gender, rather than purely on merit. It would be like if the NBA arbitrarily decided that it would only have 13% black players, 63% white, 18% hispanic, 3% asian, because that's the broader population composition - nevermind that it in no way reflects the composition of talented ball players.

text: IMHO, the best way of knowing something from the media is suspect is that they don't allow comments about it or censor them. author: @whiskeynomad
text:
No population growth does not account for the increase in voter turn-out. Look at the popular vote count for going back to the year 2000.
In 2000 U.S population ~248 million and a turnout of ~50million.
From 2004-2016 the voter turn-out would increase with the population each election, that is not what we see.
For 2020 it dramatically increased, especially compared to 2016, and Obama received nearly 70 million votes in 2008 but ~7 million less votes in 2012.
Occam's Razor isn't always correct guys.
It isn't as simple as "there are more people here now than before."

Edit: Spelling.
